alert.note: Alert for Harney County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 5:10PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Harney County through 600 PM PDT... At 510 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Diamond Craters, or 38 miles southeast of Burns, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Barton Lake around 520 PM PDT. New Princeton and eastern Malheur Lake around 540 PM PDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
